questions.text: A 28-year-old pregnant woman in her second trimester comes to the clinic for a routine check-up. Which of the following is NOT a normal physiological change during pregnancy?
Identify the correct pair:

options.label: D
options.text: 4 - C11 Pittsburg compound b PET - FNH

questions.text: A 30-year-old male with history of occasional alcohol consumption, presented to the casualty with acute abdominal pain, distention of abdomen and vomiting. On x-ray, the following was noticed. What is the next step?

A female presents to OPD with 6 weeks of amenorrhea complaints of bleeding per vagina and mild abdominal pain. The urine pregnancy test is positive and hCG level is 2800 IU/L. On investigation, mass is seen on the left adnexa measuring 5 x 2 cm. She is hemodynamically stable. How will you manage this patient?

A 29-year-old woman is brought to the physician by her father because of a change in her behavior over the past 8 months. The father says that his daughter has become increasingly withdrawn. The patient says that she has to stay at home because RAW agency is monitoring her. She thinks that they are using a magnetic field to read her mind. Mental status exam shows perseveration. She is anxious and has a flat affect. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Nayi Pahel kit given under Mission Parivar Vikas consists of all of the following except:
Which of the following is the appropriate next step?

A 28-year-old male presents to the clinic with a one-week history of fever, headache, and myalgia. He reports a recent hiking trip in a rural area of Assam. Laboratory tests reveal thrombocytopenia and elevated hepatic transaminases. Examination finding is shown. Which of the following diseases is most likely depicted by the image?
Which of the following is seen in low insulin: glucagon ratio?
An illustration of two graphs (A and B) that represent the affinity of hemoglobin for oxygen is shown. Which of the following best explains a shift from A to B?
Which of the following is the earliest marker for myocardial infarction?

A 56-year-old woman presents with 4 months of fatigue, dry mouth, blurry vision, and a persistent non-productive cough. She has injected conjunctivae and swollen parotid glands. Oral examination shows dry mucous membranes and prominent tongue fissures. ANA and anti-Ro antibodies were positive. What is she at greatest risk for?
Recommended minimum per capita space for a factory worker as per The Factory Act 1948 is:

A MRI of 60-year-old female reveals a defect in the territory served by the artery marked in given MRA. Which of the following features is not a component of the syndrome related to the vessel indicated by the yellow arrows:

options.label: A
options.text: Contralateral loss of pain & temperature in trunk and limbs

options.label: B
options.text: Contralateral loss of position and vibration sense

options.label: C
options.text: Ipsilateral loss of pain and temperature sensation from face

options.label: D
options.text: Ipsilateral paralysis of muscles of palate

questions.correct_answer: B. Contralateral loss of position and vibration sense
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Contralateral loss of position and vibration sense

questions.text: Two days after undergoing uncomplicated total knee replacement, a 55-year-old man develops increasing anxiety, agitation, hand tremor, and nausea. He told the nurse he saw a bear in his room. His pain has been controlled with intravenous morphine. He has a history of advanced liver disease. He drinks 7 cans of beer daily. He is diaphoretic. His temperature is 37.6°C (99.7°F), pulse is 118/min, respirations are 18/min, and blood pressure is 146/92 mm Hg. Administration of which of the following drugs is the most appropriate next step in treatment?

A 41-year-old male patient presents with symptoms of dysphagia and regurgitation. A barium swallow test reveals the following picture. This condition is primarily associated with weakness in which anatomical region?
According to antenatal care, the recommended ideal number of ANC visits should be:

A 42-year-old man is brought to the emergency department due to nausea, vomiting, and blurred vision. He was making his own whiskey with a home moonshine still and started feeling sick after sampling the first several ounces of distillate. Funduscopic evaluation reveals optic disc hyperemia. Laboratory results show a high anion gap metabolic acidosis. He is started on fomepizole, a medication that transiently binds to alcohol dehydrogenase. Which of the following graphs most accurately portrays the change in enzyme kinetics after administration of the antidote?

A 4-year-old boy presents to the pediatric clinic with a palpable abdominal mass. An ultrasound of the abdomen reveals a mass with stippled calcifications and displacement of the kidney inferolaterally without distortion of the collecting system. The mass is non-mobile and appears to cross the midline. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 21-year-old female college student with a history of anxiety is brought to the physician for evaluation of fatigue for the past 6 months. Over the past year, she has had extreme fluctuations in her weight and has become more distant from her friends. She admits to binge eating and induced vomiting. Examination shows poor dentition. This patient is most likely to have which of the follow in serum laboratory profiles?
questions.correct_answer: B. pH-7.49, HCO3- 34, Anion gap-9, K-3.0
questions.explanation: Ans. B) pH-7.49, HCO3- 34, Anion gap-9, K-3.0

questions.text: What is the correct sequence of umbilical artery Doppler findings indicative of progressive worsening intrauterine fetal hypoxia?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased S/D ratio – Absent end diastolic flow – Reversal of end diastolic flow

options.label: B
options.text: Absent end diastolic flow - Increased S/D ratio – Reversal of end diastolic flow

options.label: C
options.text: Reversal of end diastolic flow - Increased S/D ratio – Absent end diastolic flow

options.label: D
options.text: Increased S/D ratio – Reversal of end diastolic flow – Absent end diastolic flow

questions.correct_answer: A. Increased S/D ratio – Absent end diastolic flow – Reversal of end diastolic flow

questions.text: A 3-month-old infant presents for a routine check-up. At birth, the head circumference was 33 cm. What is the expected head circumference (HC) of this infant now?

Identify the correct statements: Thymus is a primary lymphoid organ Albumin, transferrin and TTR are negative acute phase reactants Raised 5-HIAA indicates a carcinoid syndrome Pagets disease metabolic profile will reveal raised ALP, PTH and normal calcium and phosphate.

A pediatric anesthesiologist is setting up for a procedure on a small child who will be breathing spontaneously during the surgery. The anesthesiologist chooses a specific anesthesia circuit to best support spontaneous breathing. Which of the following circuits is most appropriate for spontaneous ventilation in pediatric patients due to its low resistance and dead space?

Identify the correct statements: The greenish-black color of the first stool in the newborn is due to bilirubin According to current recommended dietary guidelines for children, energy from saturated fats should be <10% be of total energy intake Most common cause of ventriculomegaly in newborns is Arnold-Chiari malformation Steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome is defined as failure to achieve remission after 4weeks when on a daily corticosteroid therapy regimen

A 49-year-old woman, gravida 5 para 5, comes to the OPD due to involuntary, intermittent loss of urine over the past 5 months. The patient loses a small amount of urine when asked to cough. She has no dysuria, urgency, or hematuria and usually awakens once a night to void. Postvoid residual urine volume is 40 mL. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?

A research study is conducted in an urban slum in Mumbai which examined various potential risk factors for breast cancer in a group of 100 women. Based on the image shown below, how many risk factors are statistically significantly associated with breast cancer?
What is the standard usable length of rigid and flexible sigmoidoscopes?

A 32-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department by her neighbors 30 minutes after they found her unconscious. Her neighbors report that she has been spending more time at home by herself because she recently lost her job. On arrival, she is unable to provide a history. Her pulse is 76/min, respirations are 13/min, and blood pressure is 114/72 mm Hg. Examination shows significant weakness of the left upper and lower extremities. She is unable to plantar flex the ankle while supine. She is able to stand on her toes. Her gait is unsteady. Deep tendon reflexes are 3+ and symmetric. An MRI of the brain and MR angiography show no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following substances is most likely associated with chromolacryorrhea?

Which of the following staffing levels are correct standard indicators for evaluating health manpower? Doctor 1 per 3500 population ANM 1 per >1000 population Lab technician 1 per 10000 population Pharmacist 1 per 100000 population MPW 1 per 5000 population
All are true regarding peripartum cardiomyopathy except?

options.label: A
options.text: Development of cardiac failure within 5 months of delivery

questions.text: Which of the following is the inheritance of NARP?
Identify the type of injury shown in the following image:

A 13-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of a 4-week history of left groin and buttock pain. He has had many episodes of abdominal, back, and chest pain that required hospitalization in the past. There is pain with passive abduction and internal rotation of the left hip. Leukocyte count is 8,600/mm. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?
Identity the procedure shown in the image, done for a patient presenting with swelling in the groin?
A district in Madhya Pradesh has CBR 19/1000 LB and CDR is 6/1000 LB. Find the annual growth rate of the district:

A 65-year-old man presents with hematuria and left flank pain. Imaging studies reveal a renal mass, and a subsequent biopsy confirms the diagnosis of papillary renal cell carcinoma. Which of the following cytogenetic abnormalities is most characteristic of papillary chromophilic renal cell carcinoma?

A 45-year-old male with type 1 diabetes mellitus for 10 years has been managing his condition with insulin therapy. Despite good compliance, his blood glucose levels remain high. After consulting a dietitian, he is advised to consume more high-soluble fiber foods. Which of the following dietary fibers would help in maintaining normal blood glucose levels?
A 2-day-old newborn presents with respiratory distress and abdominal distension. A nasogastric tube was inserted, and an X-ray was performed as shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
An 8-day-old newborn was found to have thyroid -stimulating hormone level of more than 100 mlU/L. Which of the following will be the next best investigation?

A 28-year-old woman comes to the physician because of an 8-hour history of painful leg cramping, a runny nose, and chills. She has also had diarrhea and abdominal pain. She appears irritable and yawns frequently. Her pulse is 115/min. Examination shows cool, damp skin with piloerection. The pupils are 7 mm in diameter and equal in size. Bowel sounds are hyperactive. Deep tendon reflexes are 3+ bilaterally. What is most likely the cause of this patient's symptoms?

A 45-year-old male presents with a widespread erythematous rash over his back characterized by fine scaling and distinct areas of unaffected skin, or "islands of sparing." Considering Pityriasis Rubra Pilaris (PRP) as a potential diagnosis, which of the following clinical signs would be most supportive of this diagnosis?
Identify the device:

A 3-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with a 5-day history of fever, irritability, and rash. On examination, he has conjunctival infection, a red and swollen tongue, red cracked lips, and a polymorphous rash on his trunk. He also has erythema and swelling of his hands and feet, and desquamation of the fingers. There is no history of cough or rhinorrhea. Laboratory results show elevated inflammatory markers. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 45-year-old female patient undergoes elective open cholecystectomy after receiving prophylactic antibiotics. What is the expected rate of surgical site infection in this patient?
Identify the provided histological slide:

A 3-month-old baby is brought to OPD with jaundice and clay-colored stools. Lab work up reveals that the baby has conjugated hyperbilirubinemia. A liver biopsy was done and shows periductal proliferation. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 48-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 3-month history of low-grade fever, unintentional weight loss, night sweats, and a right-sided neck mass. Histopathologic examination of a cervical lymph node biopsy specimen shows a nodular proliferation of centrocytes and centroblasts that stain positive for CD20. Genetic analysis shows a reciprocal translocation of chromosomes 14 and 18. This patient's condition is most likely caused by mutation of an oncogene that encodes for a protein involved in which of the following cellular processes?

options.label: C
options.text: Transfer of phosphate from ATP to cellular protein

questions.text: A new drug X is given orally to a healthy volunteer in a dose of 100 mg. Plasma concentration of the drug is measured at hourly intervals and a graph is plotted between plasma concentration and time as shown in the figure. Which of the following statements about drug X is TRUE?

options.label: B
options.text: AUC from the above graph reflects the rate of absorption.

options.label: C
options.text: Tmax for drug X is 7 hours.

options.label: D
options.text: Instead of 100 mg, drug X should be given in divided doses.

questions.correct_answer: D. Instead of 100 mg, drug X should be given in divided doses.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Instead of 100 mg, drug X should be given in divided doses.

questions.text: What is the likely diagnosis of the condition shown in the image below?

Identify the true statements: Rectal temperature is better for measuring the core body temperature and is higher than axillary and oral temperature readings. Hypocalcemia, hyperkalemia, hypomagnesemia are complications of massive blood transfusion Aortic regurgitation murmur is noted during isovolumetric contraction Dyspnea on using the washroom is NYHA grade 3

A 50-year-old woman with a history of myasthenia gravis presents with worsening muscle weakness. To differentiate between a myasthenic crisis and a cholinergic crisis, which of the following drugs should be used?

A 33-year-old woman comes to the physician because of left leg pain and swelling for 1 day. She has history of two miscarriages in the past. Laboratory studies show a prothrombin time of 12 seconds and an activated partial thromboplastin time of 51 seconds. Which of the following is most likely to confirm the diagnosis?
Which of the following procedure is done for the treatment of Pilonidal sinus as shown?

A 55-year-old man with a history of chronic heart failure is undergoing evaluation for his condition. During an arterial pulse waveform analysis, the presence of a dicrotic notch is noted. The dicrotic notch in the arterial pulse waveform is preceded by which wave of JVP?

A 50-year-old researcher is conducting a study to understand the tertiary structural properties of a newly discovered protein. Various techniques are considered to analyze the protein's structure. Which of the following methods is least likely used to study the structure of proteins?
A public health campaign increases vaccination rates against HPV 16 and 18. Increased vaccination rates would have which of the following effects on the Papanicolaou test?

A 45-year-old woman presents to the outpatient department complaining of difficulty inserting a tampon and feeling something in her vagina. On examination, a vaginal swelling arising from the anterolateral vaginal wall is observed, as shown in the image. There is no cough impulse. What is your diagnosis?

A 27-year-old woman with sickle cell disease and at 39-weeks' gestation is brought to the emergency department in active labor. She has a prolonged vaginal delivery complicated by postpartum bleeding, and she receives a transfusion of 1 unit of packed red blood cells. One hour later, the patient experiences acute flank pain. Her temperature is 38.7°C (101.6°F), pulse is 115/min, respirations are 24/min, and blood pressure is 95/55 mm Hg. Foley catheter shows dark brown urine. Further evaluation of this patient is most likely to show which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Bilateral pulmonary infiltrates on chest x-ray

options.label: B
options.text: Serum antibodies against class I HLA antigens

questions.text: Which of the following is the correct sequence of cellular events of acute inflammation?

options.label: A
options.text: Rolling----Stable adhesion---Activation of integrins----Migration via endothelium

options.label: B
options.text: Rolling----Activation of Integrins----Stable Adhesion----Migration via endothelium

options.label: C
options.text: Stable adhesion---Rolling----Activation of integrins----Migration via endothelium

options.label: D
options.text: Activation of integrins----Migration via endothelium---Stable adhesion---Rolling

questions.correct_answer: B. Rolling----Activation of Integrins----Stable Adhesion----Migration via endothelium
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Rolling----Activation of Integrins----Stable Adhesion----Migration via endothelium

questions.text: Patient presents with severe restlessness, tremors to the emergency department. She has a history of bronchial asthma. On examination, a swollen neck is observed. Blood pressure and heart rate are elevated. ECG shows atrial fibrillation. Which of the following drugs can be given in this case?
A 35-year-old epidemiologist is examining various vectors of malaria for a public health report. Which of the following is not a characteristic feature of the malaria vector?

options.label: D
options.text: Rest at an angle, inclined to surface of skin

questions.text: A geriatric investigator is evaluating the consistency of Alzheimer dementia diagnoses based on clinical symptoms. Patients with known diagnoses of Alzheimer dementia were evaluated by multiple physicians during a fixed time interval. Each evaluator was blinded to the others' assessments. The extent to which the diagnosis by one physician was replicated by another clinician examining the same patient is best described by which of the following terms?
The Heart of ‘Activated sludge process’ method is:
In a surgical anatomy lecture, a professor explains the boundaries of the "Triangle of Doom," a critical area in inguinal hernia repair. Which of the following is NOT a boundary of this triangle?
A public health engineer is designing a sanitary well for a rural community to ensure safe drinking water. What is the minimum depth required for the lining of a sanitary well?
According to World Health Organization (WHO), blindness is defined as:

A patient presents with sensory loss and weakness of limbs for 3 months. He has angular stomatitis. On examination, there is loss of proprioception, vibration sensations, UMN type of lower limb weakness, absent ankle reflex. What is the probable diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Subacute combined degeneration of cord

questions.text: Match the following drugs with their ocular adverse effects:

A 28-year-old woman with an intrauterine contraceptive device (IUCD) in place becomes pregnant. She wants to continue the pregnancy. On examination, the thread of the IUCD is visible. What should be the next course of action?

options.label: C
options.text: Continue the pregnancy as it is

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman is diagnosed to have endometrial carcinoma on biopsy. She wishes to understand the high-risk factors for development of endometrial cancer. Which of the following is NOT a risk factor for development of endometrial carcinoma?

A 60-year-old man with Rheumatoid arthritis presents with fatigue, puffy face, frothy urine, and swelling of legs and feet. He takes amlodipine, methotrexate, and ibuprofen. Physical exam shows pallor, periorbital edema, and 2+ pedal edema. Labs reveal Hb 8.2 g/dL, albumin 2.8 g/dL, and urine protein 3+. What is the cause of his findings?
questions.correct_answer: D. Increased serum amyloid A production
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Increased serum amyloid A production

questions.text: A 31-year-old male comes to the physician because of a 2-day history of blisters and brownish discoloration of urine. His symptoms appeared after he returned from a 4-day trip with his friends in Goa. He has had similar episodes of blistering twice in the past three years. Each episode resolved spontaneously after a few weeks. Examination shows vesicles and bullae on the face and the dorsal surfaces of his hands and forearms. His condition is most likely caused by a defect in which of the following enzymes?
During a complicated delivery, a newborn requires immediate vascular access due to respiratory distress and suspected sepsis. Which of the following is the preferred method in this setting?
Which of the following conditions is associated with Hypokalemic metabolic alkalosis with hypertension?

A 35-year-old patient is scheduled for central venous catheter placement. The anesthesiologist discusses the landmarks used to identify the internal jugular vein for cannulation. Which of the following surface landmarks is used for this purpose?

56-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to chest palpitations The patient feels that his heartbeat is fast and irregular. The patient normally drinks only 2-3 times a year, but he hosted a party last night for his wife's birthday and consumed a large amount of alcohol. Pulse check confirms the presence of an irregularly irregular rhythm with a rate of 138/min. This patient's ECG strip is most likely to show which of the following?

A 50-year-old male, known case of cirrhosis of the liver presents with an abdominal lump. Imaging reveals solitary 3 x 4 cm nodule with rapid washout of contrast in venous phase. Which clinical criteria would decide suitability for treatment by liver transplant?

A researcher is investigating the biochemical pathways involved in glucose metabolism within liver cells. He is particularly focused on understanding why glucose 6-phosphate in the cytoplasm of hepatocytes is not immediately acted upon by glucose 6-phosphatase after its formation. Which of the following options listed below could be the reason?

options.label: A
options.text: Thermodynamically possible only when gluconeogenesis occurs

options.label: B
options.text: Needs protein kinase for its activation

options.label: C
options.text: Enzyme is present in the smooth endoplasmic reticulum (SER)

options.label: D
options.text: Steric inhibition of phosphatase by albumin

questions.correct_answer: C. Enzyme is present in the smooth endoplasmic reticulum (SER)
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Enzyme is present in the smooth endoplasmic reticulum (SER)

questions.text: An oral lesion biopsy sample from a 50-year-old female patient who had a recent history of use of broad-spectrum antibiotic, is taken for microscopic examination. The image from the biopsy specimen is shown below. Based on the findings, which of the following is the most likely etiological agent?

A 35-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with a history of prolonged fever, headache, and abdominal discomfort. The clinician suspects typhoid fever and orders a Widal test as part of the diagnostic workup. What is the principle behind the Widal test?

A 42-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 4-week history of progressive difficulty swallowing solid foods. The patient reports feeling like food gets stuck in her throat, and that she has to drink a lot of water to swallow her meals. Over the past 3 months, she has had progressive fatigue and occasional dyspnea while performing her daily activities. Her fingernails appear spoon-shaped and brittle. Further evaluation of the patient is most likely to show which of the following?

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of vibratory sense in the lower limbs

questions.text: A 55-year-old patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus is being considered for a change in therapy due to recurrent hypoglycemic episodes on his current sulfonylurea medication. The endocrinologist is considering switching him to a GLP-1 analogue. Which of the following is an advantage of GLP-1 analogues over sulfonylureas?

options.label: B
options.text: They induce insulin release at low glucose concentrations

options.label: D
options.text: These have lesser risk of precipitating hypoglycemia

questions.correct_answer: D. These have lesser risk of precipitating hypoglycemia

questions.text: A forensic expert is conducting a postmortem examination on a stillborn fetus to determine whether the fetus was viable at the time of death. Which center of ossification is commonly used as medico-legal evidence for fetal viability?

A 60-year-old man with a history of chronic kidney disease (CKD) is being treated for hypertension. His nephrologist advises against the use of certain beta-blockers due to the risk of drug accumulation and toxicity in patients with renal failure. Which of the following beta-blockers should be avoided in this patient?
Local anesthesia used in cataract surgery is:
Lesion at which point along the course of the facial nerve would lead to loss of lacrimation and taste?

options.label: A
options.text: Distal to origin of chorda tympani

options.label: B
options.text: Between second genu and midportion of vertical segment

options.label: C
options.text: Distal to geniculate ganglion and proximal to second genu

questions.text: A previously healthy 27-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 2-month history of depressed mood and fatigue. During this time, she has had a 5-kg weight gain. She reports trouble concentrating at her job as a preschool teacher and has missed work several times in recent weeks due to generalized fatigue. She has smoked 2 packs of cigarettes daily for 10 years and is actively trying to quit smoking. A drug is prescribed that will treat the patient's mood disturbance and support smoking cessation. This patient should be counseled about which of the following possible side effects of this drug?

An elderly male went for a medical examination. Laboratory investigations showed a marked elevation of lymphocytes with marked leukocytosis. The peripheral smear of the patient is given below. What is the appropriate next step for this patient?
Composition of lactulose:

A researcher is conducting a study to identify gene mutations associated with a rare genetic disorder. The researcher decides to use DNA microarrays for this purpose. Which of the following techniques allows DNA microarrays to detect gene mutations?

A group of investigators is studying the association between a fire retardant chemical used on furniture and interstitial lung disease. They use hospital records to identify 50 people who have been diagnosed with interstitial lung disease. They also identify a group of 50 people without interstitial lung disease who are matched in age and geographic location to those with the disease. The participants' exposure to the chemical is assessed by surveys and home visits. Which of the following best describes this study design?

Identify the true statements: Aminophylline acts as an adenosine receptor antagonist leading to diuresis Filgrastim is the drug of choice for chemotherapy induced thrombocytopenia Cephalosporins that do not require dose adjustment in renal failure because they are secreted in bile are ceftriaxone and cefoperazone. Denosumab can decrease bone resorption as well as increase bone formation

A 16-year-old girl is brought to the physician because she has not attained menarche. She is 165 cm (5 ft 5 in) tall and weighs 60 kg ; BMI is 22 kg/m2. Breast development is Tanner stage 4, and pubic hair development is Tanner stage 1. Pelvic examination shows a blind vaginal pouch. This patient is most likely to have which of the following karyotypes?
A 25-year-old male with epilepsy presents with gingival overgrowth as shown in the image. Which antiepileptic drug is most likely to lead to this adverse effect?

A respiratory physiology seminar presents a pressure-volume loop obtained from a patient during mechanical ventilation. The difference in the course of the inspiratory loop and the expiratory loop in the curve is being discussed. The difference in the course of the inspiratory loop and the expiratory loop in the curve is due to which of the following conditions:
Otosclerosis most commonly begins at which of the following locations?

A forensic expert is investigating a sexual assault case and needs to determine the timeline of the incident using Lugol's iodine test. What is the maximum duration after an assault that this test can yield positive results?
A 40-year-old man presents with progressive weakness in his legs, spasticity, and difficulty walking. Which toxin is most likely responsible for his symptoms?
What is the most common cause of neonatal mortality in India?

A 5-day post-operative patient on intravenous fluids presents with angular stomatitis and following appearance of cornea. Which of the following TCA cycle enzymes is most likely affected in this patient?

A 42-year-old woman comes to the physician with a 6-month history of breast tenderness and menstrual irregularities. An ultrasound of the pelvis shows a right adnexal mass. A laparoscopic right salpingo-oophorectomy is performed. Histologic examination of the adnexal mass shows small cuboidal cells arranged in clusters surrounding a central cavity with eosinophilic secretions. These cells resemble primordial follicles. Which of the following laboratory values was most likely increased in this patient at the time of presentation?

A 32-year-old man is being evaluated due to several weeks of watery diarrhea. He has also had intermittent, crampy abdominal pain and has lost 7 kg during this period. The patient has a history of HIV and was hospitalized 6 months ago for Pneumocystis pneumonia. Stool tests for leukocytes and occult blood are negative. Endoscopy is performed, and mucosal biopsy is shown. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?
The marked structure secretes which hormone?

A 35-year-old male presents to a hospital with a 3-week history of muffled hearing and a sensation of fullness in the right ear. Examination is shown below. The patient denies any recent upper respiratory infections or allergies. In managing his condition, which procedure is most appropriate to relieve his symptoms?
questions.correct_answer: B. Myringotomy with tympanostomy tube insertion

questions.text: A 62-year-old postmenopausal woman with a history of hormone receptor (HR)-positive metastatic breast cancer presents to the oncology clinic for follow-up. Her oncologist decides to initiate a treatment that works as an estrogen receptor antagonist by promoting receptor downregulation. Which of the following medications is most appropriate for this condition?
Which of the following regions remains constant during muscle contraction?

A 27-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 1-year history of progressive shortness of breath. She is now unable to jog for more than 10 minutes without stopping to catch her breath. Cardiac examination shows a harsh systolic, crescendo-decrescendo murmur best heard at the lower left sternal border. The murmur increases in intensity when she moves from a squatting to a standing position and decreases when she clenches her fists. Which of the following is the most likely cause of her condition?

A 25-year-old woman presents with progressive dyspnea and fatigue over 2 years. Physical exam reveals pedal edema, jugular venous distention, and hepatomegaly, with clear lung fields. Chest CT shows right heart enlargement. Cardiac catheterization reveals increased pulmonary arterial pressure without valve gradients or shunts. A transbronchial biopsy shows plexiform lesions with smooth muscle hypertrophy and luminal narrowing. Which of the following genetic mutations is most likely responsible?
A 28-year-old woman is in the third stage of labor, and the placenta is about to be delivered. Which statement is incorrect regarding Duncan's placental separation?
questions.correct_answer: C. Most common method of separation

questions.text: A 55-year-old woman with type 2 diabetes and breast cancer treated with tamoxifen presents with acute chest pain and syncope. She has no palpable pulses and the ECG strip is shown. CPR is initiated. What is the most appropriate next step?
Which of the following is true regarding Mendelian mode of inheritance?

options.label: A
options.text: Every 10th patient has a Y-linked disorder

options.label: B
options.text: 1/3rd of Mendelian disorders is autosomal recessive

options.label: C
options.text: Every 5th patient has an X-linked recessive disorder

options.label: D
options.text: 2/3rds (66%) of Mendelian disorders are autosomal dominant

questions.correct_answer: D. 2/3rds (66%) of Mendelian disorders are autosomal dominant
questions.explanation: Ans. D) 2/3rds (66%) of Mendelian disorders are autosomal dominant

questions.text: A 22-year-old woman comes to the physician to discuss the prescription of an oral contraceptive. She has no history of major medical illness and takes no medications. She does not smoke cigarettes. She is prescribed combined levonorgestrel and ethinylestradiol tablets. Which of the following is the most important mechanism of action of this drug in the prevention of pregnancy?

options.label: B
options.text: Inhibition of rise in luteinizing hormone

questions.correct_answer: B. Inhibition of rise in luteinizing hormone

questions.text: A pharmacology resident is studying the cardiovascular effects of three different adrenergic drugs, labelled A, B, and C. They recorded blood pressure and heart rate responses to these drugs and plotted the results as shown in the graphs below. Based on the graphs, which of the following statements is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Drug A in the graph is epinephrine

options.label: B
options.text: The effect on heart rate in graph A can be prevented by anti-muscarinic agents

options.label: C
options.text: Drug acting on graph B is isoprenaline

options.label: D
options.text: Drug acting in the graph C is nor-epinephrine

questions.correct_answer: B. The effect on heart rate in graph A can be prevented by anti-muscarinic agents
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The effect on heart rate in graph A can be prevented by anti-muscarinic agents

questions.text: Thirty minutes after normal vaginal delivery of twins, a 35-year-old woman, gravida 5, para 4, has heavy vaginal bleeding with clots. Physical examination shows a soft, enlarged, and boggy uterus. Despite bimanual uterine massage, administration of uterotonic drugs, and placement of an intrauterine balloon for tamponade, the bleeding continues. A hysterectomy is performed. Vessels running through which of the following structures must be ligated during the surgery to achieve hemostasis?

A 35-year-old woman has inherited a mutant BRCA1 gene and has a 60% chance of developing breast cancer by the age of 50. The BRCA1 gene produces a protein involved in the repair of DNA double-strand breaks. Which of the following processes is adversely affected by the deficiency of the BRCA1 protein?
Identify the marked structure

A 69-year-old man is brought to the emergency department because of severe epigastric pain and vomiting that started 30 minutes ago while gardening. His pulse is 55/min, respirations are 30/min, and blood pressure is 90/50 mm Hg. Crackles are heard in both lower lung fields. An ECG shows ST segment elevation in leads II, III, and aVF. Coronary angiography is most likely to show narrowing of which of the following vessels?
A 50-year-old man suddenly developed right-sided weakness and aphasia within 2 hours. His BP recorded was 160/110 mmHg and NCCT was clear. What is the next step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: CT angiography to look for large vessel occlusion

options.label: B
options.text: MRI to look for infarct Occlusion

questions.text: In a patient who died from ventilator associated pneumonia after prolonged ventilation due to an intracerebral hemorrhage caused by cerebral metastases from a squamous cell carcinoma of the left main bronchus. What should be recorded in the line I (c) of the death certificate?

options.label: D
options.text: Squamous cell carcinoma of the left main bronchus

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair:

A patient met with a road traffic accident and developed a cervical spine injury. The fracture fragment had pierced the medial aspect of the dorsal column tract. Which of the following findings is seen in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Absence of ipsilateral lower limb proprioception

options.label: B
options.text: Absence of fine motor movement of fingers

options.label: D
options.text: Absence of contralateral lower limb proprioception

questions.correct_answer: A. Absence of ipsilateral lower limb proprioception

questions.text: A research group wants to assess the safety and toxicity profile of a new drug. A clinical trial is conducted with 20 volunteers to estimate the maximum tolerated dose and monitor the apparent toxicity of the drug. The study design is best described as which of the following phases of a clinical trial?
Which of the following reactions does not contribute to the production of NADPH for fatty acid synthesis?
All of the following muscles have parallel oriented fibers except:

A forensic expert is analyzing a gunshot wound found on a deceased individual during an autopsy. The wound shows extensive tissue damage around the entry point, suggesting a specific range of fire. Based on the wound characteristics presented in the image, what is the most likely distance between the victim and the firearm?

41-year-old man, who was recently found to have renal vein thrombosis, is under medical review. His medical history includes significant weight gain, generalized edema, and hypertension. His urine analysis reveals significant proteinuria and the presence of numerous normal-looking red blood cells without any casts. Tests also show positive anti-PLA2R antibodies. Based on these findings, what would you expect to see on his renal biopsy?

options.label: A
options.text: Diffuse thickening of the GBM with a spike and dome pattern

questions.correct_answer: A. Diffuse thickening of the GBM with a spike and dome pattern

questions.text: A 24-year-old swimmer presents with sudden onset of fever, headache, nausea, and neck stiffness. After a few days, the patient develops confusion and seizures. The microscopic slide of CSF is shown below. Based on the clinical presentation and microscopic findings, which of the following organisms is most likely responsible for these symptoms?
Correctly match the sites of cardiac valve auscultation from the given image.

options.label: A
options.text: A = pulmonary, B = aortic, C = tricuspid, D = Mitral

options.label: B
options.text: A = aortic, B = pulmonary, C = tricuspid, D = Mitral

options.label: C
options.text: A = tricuspid, B = aortic, C = pulmonary, D = Mitral

options.label: D
options.text: A = aortic, B = tricuspid, C = pulmonary, D = Mitral

questions.correct_answer: B. A = aortic, B = pulmonary, C = tricuspid, D = Mitral
questions.explanation: Ans. B) A = aortic, B = pulmonary, C = tricuspid, D = Mitral

questions.text: A 30-year-old pregnant woman undergoing treatment for leprosy presents with symptoms of Erythema Nodosum Leprosum (ENL), a severe inflammatory reaction. What is the appropriate management strategy in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Discontinue anti-leprosy medication and initiate steroids and antibiotics

options.label: D
options.text: Continue anti-leprosy medication and add steroids

questions.correct_answer: D. Continue anti-leprosy medication and add steroids
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Continue anti-leprosy medication and add steroids

questions.text: The nerve being tested here is injured most likely at what site?

options.label: A
options.text: Between two heads of pronator teres

options.label: B
options.text: At the level of supinator muscle

questions.text: Which of the following drugs can act at both sites labelled as 1 and 2 in the diagram?

A 36-year-old woman comes to the physician for an annual pelvic examination and Pap smear. Her last Pap smear was 3 years ago. A photomicrograph of cervical cells from the Pap smear specimen is shown. Cells similar to the one indicated by the arrow are most likely to be seen in which of the following conditions?
Which artery is being palpated?

A 5-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his parents because of a 6-week history of increased tiredness, irritability, and worsening leg pain. Examination shows conjunctival pallor and diffuse petechiae. There are palpable, nontender posterior cervical and axillary lymph nodes. His hemoglobin concentration is 8.9 g/dL, leukocyte count is 45,750/mm , and platelet count is 25,000/mm'. A bone marrow aspiration shows numerous immature cells that stain positive for CD10, CD19, and terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase (TT). Which of the following translocations is associated with a favorable prognosis for this patient's condition?

A patient underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy for cholelithiasis. Histopathology of the resected gall bladder is reported as Stage T1a of gallbladder cancer. What would be the next line of management?

Match the following light measurement units with their correct descriptions: Column A Candela Lumen Lux Lambert Column B Flow of light Amount of light reaching surface Amount of light re-emitted by surface Luminous intensity

A 55-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after collapsing at the grocery store and losing consciousness for 1 minute following a sudden onset of palpitations. He has a history of hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and is currently being treated as an outpatient for pneumonia. His current medications include lisinopril, metformin, and azithromycin. During the examination, he loses consciousness again. ECGshows polymorphic ventricular tachycardia with cyclic alteration of the QRS axis, which spontaneously resolves after 30 seconds. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's syncope?
Which of the following is a true statement?

options.label: B
options.text: Recurrent laryngeal nerve supplies all intrinsic muscles of larynx

options.label: C
options.text: Sensory supply to the larynx is by superior laryngeal nerve only

options.label: D
options.text: False vocal cord is formed by the lower border of aryepiglottic fold

questions.correct_answer: D. False vocal cord is formed by the lower border of aryepiglottic fold

questions.text: Identify the correct statements Potassium levels in vitreous humor fall linearly after death and are a useful measure of time of death. Suspended animation can be seen after electrocution. The 'chicken fat' appearance is typical of a postmortem thrombus. TM, lung and colon are susceptible in secondary blast injury.
Which of the following statements is incorrect about non-invasive prenatal testing?

options.label: A
options.text: It uses cell-free circulating fetal DNA in the maternal serum.

options.label: B
options.text: It is used for the confirmation of trisomy 13, 18 and 21.

options.label: C
options.text: It can be performed after 10 weeks of gestation.

options.label: D
options.text: It is done after the routine first trimester ultrasound assessment.

questions.correct_answer: B. It is used for the confirmation of trisomy 13, 18 and 21.

questions.text: A 34-year-old man comes to the physician because of foul-smelling diarrhea, fatigue, and bloating for 6 months. He has type 1 diabetes mellitus that is well-controlled with insulin. Examination shows conjunctival pallor and inflammation of the corners of the mouth. The patient undergoes upper endoscopy. A photomicrograph of tissue from an intestinal biopsy is shown. Which of the following is most likely to improve this patient's symptoms?

A 14-year-old girl presents to the clinic with localized pain in her left knee that worsens at night. She has no significant past medical history and reports no recent trauma. Physical examination reveals mild swelling and tenderness over the proximal tibia. Laboratory studies show normal white blood cell count and inflammatory markers. An X-ray of the knee is performed, revealing a well-defined lytic lesion with sclerotic margins in the proximal tibial metaphysis. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

As a medical officer at a district hospital, you are analyzing skeletal remains discovered during an excavation to determine the sex of the deceased. Which of the following indices is typically higher in the male pelvis?
A 30-year-old male sustains a degloving injury to his right lower leg in a motorcycle accident. Which triage color code is most appropriate for this injury?
Identify the correct ASA-PS grade:
What is the mechanism of action of the toxin produced by the bacterium shown in the figure below?
Identify the fracture shown in the given image:
Identify the correct statements: Social smile – 2months Walk without support -12months Babbling gibberish-15months Walk upstairs with alternate foot – 4yrs Copy a circle-2yrs

A 79-year-old man with aortic stenosis comes to the emergency room because of worsening fatigue for 5 months. During this time, he has also had intermittent bright red blood mixed in with his stool. Physical examination shows pale conjunctivae and a crescendo-decrescendo systolic murmur best heard at the second right intercostal space. The abdomen is soft and non-tender. Laboratory studies show a hemoglobin of 8 g/dL and a mean corpuscular volume of 71 um. Which of the following is the most likely underlying mechanism of this patient's bleeding?

options.label: A
options.text: Thrombus in the superior mesenteric artery

options.label: B
options.text: Transmural inflammation of the large bowel

options.label: C
options.text: Atherosclerotic narrowing of the mesenteric arteries

questions.text: During a radiology department seminar, a discussion focuses on the properties and safety of gadolinium-based contrast agents. Which of the following statements about gadolinium is false?

options.label: A
options.text: It can cross the blood-brain barrier (BBB)

options.label: B
options.text: Paramagnetic material which can shorten the T1 relaxation time

options.label: C
options.text: Long-term studies show gadolinium deposition in the basal ganglia at high doses

questions.correct_answer: A. It can cross the blood-brain barrier (BBB)
questions.explanation: Ans. A) It can cross the blood-brain barrier (BBB)

questions.text: A 25-year-old male was brought to the emergency department after being struck on his head by the house door and temporarily fainting. On examination, his sensorium was intact. NCCT head was performed and study was normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?

Identify the wrong statements 1. HU for fat is 100 2. Iohexol may be used as an oral contrast in suspected oesophageal perforation 3. BMFT is useful for evaluation of colonic strictures 4. Dose of radiation is directly proportional to the square of the distance from the source
Identify the incorrect pair

A patient was started on anticoagulant therapy for deep vein thrombosis (DVT). The next day, he presented with the features shown in the figure below. Which of the following drugs is most likely implicated in this condition?
A young male came to the hospital with a clean-cut wound without any bleeding. The patient received a full course of tetanus vaccination 10 years ago. What is the best management for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Human tetanus immunoglobulin and full course of vaccine

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman with irritable bowel syndrome comes to the physician because of increased diarrhea. The increase in stool frequency began when she started a new job. She is started on loperamide, and her symptoms improve. Which of the following is the primary mechanism of action of this drug?

A research group conducted a placebo-controlled clinical trial to assess whether a new drug to treat acute migraine with or without aura in adults is more effective than standard therapy. During the data analysis phase, the researchers decide to set alpha at 0.01 rather than 0.05. Which of the following is the most likely result of this change?

options.label: A
options.text: Any significant findings will be reported with greater confidence

options.label: B
options.text: There will be a higher probability of a type I error

options.label: C
options.text: There will be a higher probability of finding statistically significant results

options.label: D
options.text: The study will have more statistical power

questions.correct_answer: A. Any significant findings will be reported with greater confidence

questions.text: A 45-year-old female presents with something coming out per anus. Which of the following is not the perineal approach for this disease?
What is the fluid requirement in a 3 days old baby with birth weight of 1300 grams?

A 37-year-old woman visits the clinic, reporting excessive daytime sleepiness, vivid hallucinations when falling asleep and upon waking, and difficulty initiating sleep at night. Which of the following is NOT a characteristic symptom of narcolepsy?

A 25-year-old male patient presented with sudden onset breathlessness and a sharp pain in his chest after a road traffic accident. His BP is 85/69mm Hg and HR is 110bpm. The chest X-ray is given below. What is the next step for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Insert iv cannula and start iv fluids

questions.text: A 35-year-old female patient with a long history of severe eosinophilic asthma presents to the clinic. Despite being treated with high-dose inhaled corticosteroids and long-acting beta-agonists, she continues to have frequent asthma exacerbations requiring systemic corticosteroids. After further evaluation, the physician decides to initiate a monoclonal antibody therapy that targets IL-5R. Which of the following medications targets IL-5R and works by antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity (ADCC)?

You are a medical resident working in a busy hospital when a 25-year-old female patient is admitted with complaints of chronic fatigue, easy bruising, and hepatosplenomegaly. A bone marrow examination reveals cells with a characteristic appearance as shown in an image. In this clinical scenario, which enzyme deficiency is most likely responsible for her condition?
20 accidental pregnancies happen after 100 women used a new contraceptive device for 2yrs. What is the pearl index?

A 45-year-old woman presents to the clinic with persistent joint pain and swelling in her hands and knees. Laboratory tests reveal elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) and C-reactive protein (CRP). Further testing shows elevated levels of multiple cytokines. Which of the following cytokines is least likely to be involved in promoting inflammation in this patient?

A 45-year-old man is brought to the clinic by his wife, who reports a year-long history of the patient's declining memory and cognitive abilities. The patient was previously diagnosed with a type of cortical dementia. Which of the following is NOT classified as a cortical dementia?

A patient has hyperkalemia, raised uric acid levels and is going through hemodialysis. While this, patient develops drowsiness, had a seizure and got hypotensive. What can be given in treatment for this condition?

A 46-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital because of tarry-black stools and epigastric pain for 2 weeks. The epigastric pain is relieved after meals, but worsens after 1-2 hours. Fecal occult blood test is positive. Esophagogastroduodenoscopy shows a bleeding duodenal ulcer. Microscopic examination of a duodenal biopsy specimen is most likely to show which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Gram-negative S-shaped rods with polar flagella

questions.text: The most common organism causing osteomyelitis in drug abusers is:
A 45-year-old woman with a family history of breast cancer is found to have a BRCA1 mutation. Which of the following characteristics is associated with a BRCA1 mutation compared to a BRCA2 mutation?

options.label: A
options.text: Located on the long arm of chromosome 13

questions.text: A 60-year-old woman has been a cigarette smoker since the age of 18, averaging a pack a day of unfiltered cigarettes. She works as a dispatcher for a trucking company. She has had several episodes of hemoptysis in the past two weeks along with fatigue, headache, nausea, and anorexia. On physical examination, her sensorium is clouded. A chest radiograph shows an ill-defined hilar mass. A transbronchial lung biopsy is performed and the microscopic appearance is shown here. Which of the following laboratory test findings is most likely to be present in this woman?
Calculate the mid parental height of a male patient with father height 183 cm and mother height 175cm?
Which intracellular molecule is primarily responsible for mediating the effects of ANP?
The diffusing capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide is decreased in patients with:

A 9 -year-old boy presents to the emergency department because of 18 hours of severe vomiting. Arterial blood gas analysis reveals a pH of 7.48, a bicarbonate level of 35 mEq/L, and a partial carbon dioxide pressure of 48 mm Hg. Which of the following best describes the acid-base disturbance occurring in this patient?
questions.correct_answer: D. Metabolic alkalosis with respiratory compensation
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Metabolic alkalosis with respiratory compensation

questions.text: A 70-year-old male with a long history of smoking presents to the clinic with a chronic non-productive cough that has persisted for 6 months. He also reports weight loss, anorexia, and intermittent chest pain. A chest CT scan reveals a mass lesion, and a biopsy is performed (image provided). Which of the following statements best describes the pathology seen in this patient's biopsy?

options.label: C
options.text: Cells are p63 and p40 positive

questions.correct_answer: C. Cells are p63 and p40 positive
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Cells are p63 and p40 positive

questions.text: 28-year women with chronic pelvic pain and infertility of 3 years. A transvaginal ultrasound reveals the following. What is your diagnosis?
All of the following are true except:

options.label: A
options.text: Codex Alimentarius is the principal organ of the FAO/WHO food standards program

options.label: B
options.text: Vanaspati is fortified with 2500 IU of vitamin A and 175 IU of vitamin D

options.label: C
options.text: Methylene blue reduction test is the best test for efficacy of pasteurisation

options.label: D
options.text: Sudden onset of hypersecretory glaucoma, diarrhea, and cardiac failure is seen due to sanguinarine toxicity

questions.correct_answer: C. Methylene blue reduction test is the best test for efficacy of pasteurisation
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Methylene blue reduction test is the best test for efficacy of pasteurisation

questions.text: A 2-day old infant presents with bilious vomiting and abdominal distension. AXR is shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?

Dr. Kavita, a recent medical school graduate, is attending a workshop on medical law. The presenter discusses a case where a patient alleged civil negligence against a physician, but the lawsuit was not filed within the legally designated period. Dr. Kavita is asked to identify the legal doctrine that bars the case from being opened after this period. Which term correctly identifies this doctrine?

A 31-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 2-day history of abdominal pain and diarrhea. He reports that his stools are streaked with blood and mucus. He returned from a vacation in Kerala 3 weeks ago. His vital signs are within normal limits. Abdominal examination shows hyperactive bowel sounds. A photomicrograph of a trichrome-stained wet mount of a stool specimen is shown. Which of the following organisms is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?
Which drug is used in conjunction with phentermine for the management of obesity?
Identify the incorrect pair:

options.label: A
options.text: Level of uterus on day 2- 2 finger breadth below umbilicus

questions.text: A group of environmental health scientists recently performed a nationwide cross-sectional study that investigated the risk of head and neck cancers in patients with a history of cigar smoking. In collaboration with three teams of epidemiologists that have each conducted similar cross-sectional studies in their respective countries, they have agreed to contribute their data to an international pooled analysis of the relationship between non- cigarette tobacco consumption and prevalence of head and neck cancers. Which of the following statements regarding the pooled analysis in comparison to the individual studies is true?

options.label: A
options.text: It overcomes limitations in the quality of individual studies.

options.label: B
options.text: It is able to provide evidence of causality.

options.label: D
options.text: The likelihood of type II errors is decreased.

questions.correct_answer: D. The likelihood of type II errors is decreased.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) The likelihood of type II errors is decreased.

questions.text: A 56-year-old man, who recently recovered from a viral infection, visits his primary care physician for a follow-up. The physician orders a blood test to assess the patient's immune status, specifically focusing on identifying memory T cells, which are crucial for long-term immunity. Which of the following markers will the lab use to identify the memory T cells in this patient?
The defined population norm for Urban-Primary health centre in our country is?
Which of the following diseases is most likely transmitted by this vector?
Match the following steps of ventricular action potential in the correct order:
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A-2, B-3, C-4, D-1, E-5

questions.text: Sludder’s neuralgia is due to compression of anterior ethmoidal nerve by septal spur in the region of:

A 48-year-old man comes to the emergency department because of sudden right flank pain that began 3 hours ago. He also noticed blood in his urine. Over the past two weeks, he has developed progressive lower extremity swelling and a 4-kg weight gain. Examination shows bilateral 2+ pitting edema of the lower extremities. Urinalysis with dipstick shows 4+ protein, positive glucose, and multiple red cell and fatty casts. Abdominal CT shows a large right kidney with abundant collateral vessels and a filling defect in the right renal vein. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's symptoms? Hemoglobin : 8 g/dL Platelet count :195,000/mm? Prothrombin time :12 sec Partial thromboplastin time: 49 sec
Indications of chest drain in a parapneumonic effusion are all except:
A 30-year-old woman presents with sudden onset of intense eye redness, watery discharge, and following appearance. Which of the following viruses is the most likely causative agent?
In the presented spirometry image, what term corresponds to the point labeled as ‘D’ and ‘G’ respectively?

options.label: A
options.text: Vital capacity and Functional residual volume

options.label: B
options.text: Inspiratory capacity and Functional residual capacity

options.label: C
options.text: Vital capacity and Expiratory reserve volume

questions.correct_answer: B. Inspiratory capacity and Functional residual capacity

questions.text: A public health researcher is studying the demographic transition model in India to understand population dynamics over time. The researcher is particularly interested in the contraction of the demographic gap, which is the difference between birth and death rates. At what stage of the demographic transition does the contraction of the demographic gap typically start?

A 52-year-old male presents with headache, confusion, visual disturbances, nausea, vomiting and seizures. On examination blood pressure is 220/110 mm Hg. Which of the following treatments is most appropriate for managing his condition?
What does the x-axis of ROC curve represent?
What is the IOC for PTH adenoma?

A 60-year-old man presents to the clinic with complaints of shortness of breath and palpitations. On physical examination, you perform this test and you also hear a diastolic murmur over the left sternal border. What is the most likely diagnosis?
